variants.Description in input context: Clinical mutations in PINK1 leading to decreased Complex I activity and synaptic dysfunction.

Material used.Material Name: Wild-type and mutant PINK1 cell lines
Material used.Description: Experiments were conducted using both mouse neuronal cells and fruit fly models.

Readout description.Result Description: Complex I activity was significantly reduced in cells with PINK1 mutations.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple biological replicates were performed for each experiment.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate to ensure consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 expression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells with non-functional PINK1 mutations served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA and t-tests were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Complex I activity above 80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Complex I activity below 50% of wild-type levels.

Approved assay.Description: These assays are commonly used in Parkinson's disease research.

Material used.Description: Flies were used to assess synaptic transmission and function.

Readout description.Result Description: Electrophysiological recordings showed impaired synaptic transmission in mutant flies.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple biological replicates were performed for each experiment.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate to ensure consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type flies were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Flies with non-functional PINK1 mutations served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA and t-tests were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Synaptic transmission above 80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Synaptic transmission below 50% of wild-type levels.

Approved assay.Description: These assays are commonly used in Parkinson's disease research.
